Submodules

leopard_id.inference_embeddings module

class leopard_id.inference_embeddings.InferenceDataset(image_folder, mask_folder, transform=None, transform_binary=None, existing_files=None)[source]

Bases: Dataset

A custom Dataset for inference on leopard images.

This dataset loads image and mask (edge detection) pairs, applies transformations, and prepares them for inference in the leopard identification model.

image_folder

Path to the folder containing leopard images.

Type:

str

mask_folder

Path to the folder containing corresponding mask images.

Type:

str

transform

Optional transform to be applied on images.

Type:

callable, optional

transform_binary

Optional transform to be applied on mask images.

Type:

callable, optional

pairs

List of tuples containing pairs of (image_path, mask_path).

Type:

list

leopard_id.inference_embeddings.create_transforms(config)[source]

Create image transformation pipelines based on the configuration. Same normalization and resizing as applied in training.

Parameters:

config (dict) – Configuration dictionary containing transformation parameters.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • common_transforms (transforms.Compose): Transformations for regular images.

  • binary_transforms (transforms.Compose): Transformations for binary mask images.

Return type:

tuple

leopard_id.inference_embeddings.load_model(config)[source]

Load the pre-trained leopard identification model.

Parameters:

config (dict) – Configuration dictionary containing model parameters.

Returns:

The loaded and initialized model.

Return type:

EmbeddingNetwork

leopard_id.inference_embeddings.run_inference(config_path)[source]

Run the inference process for leopard identification.

This function performs the following steps: 1. Load configuration 2. Set up directories 3. Preprocess images if required 4. Load existing data (if any) 5. Run inference on new images 6. Update embeddings and distance matrix 7. Save results

Parameters:

config_path (str) – Path to the configuration JSON file.
